preposition.description: From side to side of; across.
examples: a long counter thrown athwart the entranceway
these statistics run sharply athwart conventional presumptions

adverb.description: Across from side to side; transversely.
examples: one table running athwart was all the room would hold

adverb.description: So as to be perverse or contradictory.
examples: our words ran athwart and we ended up at cross purposes

origin: Late Middle English: from a- on + thwart.
